oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Orders No. 40 and No. 66 regarding the death of President Lincoln
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Published copy, General Order No. 40, Headquarters, Dept. of Mississippi, Vicksburg, April 28, 1865, on the death of President Lincoln. General Order No. 66, April 16, 1865, announces the "untimely and lamentable death" of the President, and is signed by Secretary of War Edwin M. Stanton. The Armies of the U.S. "share...the feelings of grief and horror inspired by this most atrocious murder." The order establishes the protocol for mourning.
